laboratory_examinations.findings: A cluster of cysts between the 12 o’clock position and the 1 o’clock position; a thick-walled cyst, 1.8 cm in diameter, between the 11 o’clock position and the 12 o’clock position.
An ill-defined, lobulated, enhancing mass, 2.9 cm by 2.7 cm by 2.5 cm, in the upper outer quadrant of the left breast.
A lytic destructive lesion, 1.8 cm by 1.6 cm by 1.5 cm, in the right side of the T6 vertebral body.
A focus of increased uptake in the right aspect of the T6 vertebral body, suggesting possible metastasis.

laboratory_examinations.procedure_name: Needle biopsy of the T6 vertebral lesion
laboratory_examinations.date: Twelve days after the visit to the oncologist

laboratory_examinations.findings: All four tissue cores showed involvement by infiltrating ductal carcinoma.
Contained metastatic adenocarcinoma with features similar to those in the breast-biopsy specimen.
Showing enlarging axillary nodes from approximately 2 cm to 5 cm in diameter.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Grew rapidly over a period of several weeks.
